intro: Miconia vesicaria, commonly known as the blister miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 50 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Miconia vesicaria is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
